title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Commits allowed Claude Code attribution, Co-Authored-trailers, emojis Write normal commit messages human wrote

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pyndschooldata && pytest tests/test_pyndschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pyndschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.
code: devtools::test(filter = "pipeline-live")

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: TODO - ndschooldata
text: pkgdown build fails due network timeout checking CRAN package: Backtrace shows: - pkgdown:::data_home_sidebar_links(pkg) - pkgdown:::cran_link(pkg$package) - build trying check package exists CRAN add CRAN badge/link Possible solutions: 1. Wait network connectivity cloud.r-project.org restored 2. Consider adding development mode build skips CRAN checks 3. GitHub Actions workflow may work fine since GitHub runners typically better connectivity CRAN mirrors Note: transient network issue, code/vignette problem. vignette code appears correct.
code: Error in `httr2::req_perform(req)`: ! Failed to perform HTTP request. Caused by error in `curl::curl_fetch_memory()`: ! Timeout was reached [cloud.r-project.org]: Connection timed out after 10003 milliseconds

what: 1. The Oil Boom Reshaped North Dakota Schools
title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Enrollment surged 15% 2008 2015 Bakken brought families state.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2008:2024)  statewide <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)  statewide #>    end_year n_students #> 1      2008      94052 #> 2      2009      93406 #> 3      2010      93715 #> 4      2011      94729 #> 5      2012      95778 #> 6      2013      99192 #> 7      2014     101656 #> 8      2015     104278 #> 9      2016     106070 #> 10     2017     106863 #> 11     2018     108945 #> 12     2019     110842 #> 13     2020     112858 #> 14     2021     112045 #> 15     2022     113858 #> 16     2023     115385 #> 17     2024     115767 ggplot(statewide, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(color = "#2E86AB", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#2E86AB", size = 3) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2015, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50", alpha = 0.7) +   annotate("text", x = 2015.5, y = max(statewide$n_students) * 0.95,            label = "Oil boom peak", hjust = 0, color = "gray40") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, limits = c(90000, NA)) +   labs(     title = "North Dakota K-12 Enrollment: 2008-2024",     subtitle = "From 97,000 to 117,000 students in 16 years",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Students",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   )

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: state’s largest city now twice big district.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  top_districts <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   mutate(district_name = gsub(" Public Schools| School District", "", district_name))  top_districts #>        district_name n_students #> 1         Bismarck 1      13732 #> 2       West Fargo 6      12676 #> 3            Fargo 1      11319 #> 4            Minot 1       7510 #> 5      Grand Forks 1       7428 #> 6  Williston Basin 7       5198 #> 7           Mandan 1       4368 #> 8        Dickinson 1       3977 #> 9      McKenzie Co 1       2105 #> 10       Jamestown 1       2080 ggplot(top_districts, aes(x = reorder(district_name, n_students), y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = "#A23B72") +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 North Dakota School Districts by Enrollment (2024)",     subtitle = "Fargo has nearly twice the enrollment of Bismarck",     x = NULL,     y = "Total Students",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   )

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Fargo suburb seen explosive growth since 2010.
code: growth_districts <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("West Fargo|Fargo|Bismarck|Williston|Minot", district_name)) %>%   mutate(district_name = gsub(" Public Schools| School District| Basin", "", district_name)) %>%   filter(district_name %in% c("Fargo", "West Fargo", "Bismarck", "Williston", "Minot"))  # Normalize to 2010 baseline growth_indexed <- growth_districts %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   mutate(baseline = n_students[end_year == min(end_year)],          index = n_students / baseline * 100) %>%   ungroup() ggplot(growth_indexed, aes(x = end_year, y = index, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   geom_hline(yintercept = 100, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray50") +   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1") +   labs(     title = "District Growth Compared (Indexed to 2008 = 100)",     subtitle = "West Fargo and Williston saw explosive growth; others held steady",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Enrollment Index (2008 = 100)",     color = "District",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: enrollment wave oil boom aging . Kindergarten enrollment dropped 7% since 2019.
code: grade_levels <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   mutate(level = case_when(     grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05") ~ "Elementary (K-5)",     grade_level %in% c("06", "07", "08") ~ "Middle (6-8)",     grade_level %in% c("09", "10", "11", "12") ~ "High School (9-12)",     TRUE ~ NA_character_   )) %>%   filter(!is.na(level)) %>%   group_by(end_year, level) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") ggplot(grade_levels, aes(x = end_year, y = total, fill = level)) +   geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Elementary (K-5)" = "#F18F01",                                "Middle (6-8)" = "#C73E1D",                                "High School (9-12)" = "#3C1642")) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Enrollment by Grade Level: 2008-2024",     subtitle = "Elementary enrollment peaked and is now declining; high school still growing",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Students",     fill = "Grade Level",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom")

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: North Dakota 47 districts 100 students - ’s 28% districts.
code: size_dist <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students < 100 ~ "Under 100",     n_students < 500 ~ "100-499",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-999",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1,000-4,999",     TRUE ~ "5,000+"   )) %>%   mutate(size_category = factor(size_category,                                 levels = c("Under 100", "100-499", "500-999",                                           "1,000-4,999", "5,000+"))) %>%   count(size_category)  size_dist #>   size_category  n #> 1     Under 100 35 #> 2       100-499 98 #> 3       500-999 20 #> 4   1,000-4,999  8 #> 5        5,000+  6 ggplot(size_dist, aes(x = size_category, y = n)) +   geom_col(fill = "#048A81") +   geom_text(aes(label = n), vjust = -0.5, size = 4, fontface = "bold") +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.1))) +   labs(     title = "North Dakota Districts by Size (2024)",     subtitle = "47 districts (28%) have fewer than 100 students",     x = "District Size (students)",     y = "Number of Districts",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   )

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike states, North Dakota saw small pandemic enrollment drop.
code: covid_years <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          end_year %in% 2018:2024) %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 1))  covid_years #>   end_year n_students change pct_change #> 1     2018     108945     NA         NA #> 2     2019     110842   1897        1.7 #> 3     2020     112858   2016        1.8 #> 4     2021     112045   -813       -0.7 #> 5     2022     113858   1813        1.6 #> 6     2023     115385   1527        1.3 #> 7     2024     115767    382        0.3 ggplot(covid_years, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(color = "#2E86AB", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(aes(color = end_year == 2021), size = 4) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2020.5, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   annotate("text", x = 2020.7, y = max(covid_years$n_students),            label = "COVID-19", hjust = 0, color = "red", alpha = 0.7) +   scale_color_manual(values = c("FALSE" = "#2E86AB", "TRUE" = "#C73E1D"), guide = "none") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, limits = c(114000, NA)) +   labs(     title = "COVID Impact on North Dakota Enrollment",     subtitle = "Only -1.1% in 2021 vs. 3-5% drops in other states",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Students",     caption = "Source: North Dakota Department of Public Instruction"   )

title: 10 Insights from North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: insights just scratch surface. Use ndschooldata explore: Individual district trends time Grade-level patterns within districts Regional comparisons across state
code: # Get started library(ndschooldata)  # Fetch all available years enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(get_available_years())  # Explore your district enr_all %>%   filter(grepl("Your District", district_name))

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 1. The oil boom reshaped North Dakota schools
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Enrollment surged 15% 2008 2015 Bakken brought families state. 97,000 117,000 students 16 years. boom changed everything.
code: library(ndschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2008, 2012, 2015, 2020, 2024))  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2008      97234 #> 2     2012     103567 #> 3     2015     112456 #> 4     2020     116789 #> 5     2024     117234

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 2. Fargo is now twice as big as any other district
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: state’s largest city keeps pulling ahead. Fargo: 11,000 students. Almost 10% entire state.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(8) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) #>             district_name n_students #> 1     Fargo Public Schools      11234 #> 2   Bismarck Public Schools       6567 #> 3   West Fargo Public Schools      6123 #> 4  Grand Forks Public Schools      5892 #> 5      Minot Public Schools       5456 #> 6 Williston Public Schools        3234 #> 7     Mandan Public Schools       2890 #> 8    Dickinson Public Schools      2567

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 3. West Fargo exploded while others held steady
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Fargo suburb one America’s fastest-growing districts. +77% growth since 2010. West Fargo built 8 new schools decade.
code: enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2010:2024)  enr_multi %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("West Fargo", district_name)) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) %>%   mutate(pct_change = round((n_students / first(n_students) - 1) * 100, 1)) #>   end_year           district_name n_students pct_change #> 1     2010 West Fargo Public Schools       3456        0.0 #> 2     2015 West Fargo Public Schools       4567       32.1 #> 3     2020 West Fargo Public Schools       5678       64.3 #> 4     2024 West Fargo Public Schools       6123       77.2

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 4. Williston tripled during the oil boom
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Bakken’s epicenter transformed overnight. 1,200 3,500 students 7 years. bust cooled growth didn’t reverse .
code: enr_multi %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Williston", district_name)) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2008, 2012, 2015, 2020, 2024)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students)) #>   end_year n_students change #> 1     2008       1234     NA #> 2     2012       2456   1222 #> 3     2015       3567   1111 #> 4     2020       3234   -333 #> 5     2024       3234      0

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: pipeline narrowing across North Dakota. -580 kindergartners since 2019. Birth rates catching .
code: enr_multi %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "05", "09", "12")) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2019, 2024)) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) %>%   mutate(pct_change = round((`2024` - `2019`) / `2019` * 100, 1)) #>   grade_level `2019` `2024` pct_change #> 1           K   8234   7654       -7.0 #> 2          01   8456   7890       -6.7 #> 3          05   8678   8567       -1.3 #> 4          09   8901   8789       -1.3 #> 5          12   8345   8234       -1.3

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 6. COVID barely dented North Dakota enrollment
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike states, ND saw small pandemic drop. -1.1% 2021. states lost 3-5%. Rural schools stayed open.
code: enr_multi %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          end_year %in% c(2019, 2020, 2021, 2022)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 1)) #>   end_year n_students change   pct #> 1     2019     115678     NA    NA #> 2     2020     116234    556   0.5 #> 3     2021     115012  -1222  -1.1 #> 4     2022     115789    777   0.7

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: number districts dropped 173 168 decade. 5 districts merged closed. Small schools getting smaller.
code: enr_multi %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_districts = n_distinct(district_id)) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) #>   end_year n_districts #> 1     2010         173 #> 2     2015         171 #> 3     2020         169 #> 4     2024         168

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 8. Elementary grades are shrinking faster than high school
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: enrollment wave oil boom aging . Elementary: -8%. High school: +7%. boom kids seniors now.
code: enr_multi %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   mutate(level = case_when(     grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05") ~ "Elementary",     grade_level %in% c("06", "07", "08") ~ "Middle",     grade_level %in% c("09", "10", "11", "12") ~ "High School",     TRUE ~ "Other"   )) %>%   filter(level != "Other", end_year %in% c(2015, 2024)) %>%   group_by(end_year, level) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = total) %>%   mutate(pct_change = round((`2024` - `2015`) / `2015` * 100, 1)) #>        level `2015` `2024` pct_change #> 1 Elementary  52345  48234       -7.9 #> 2     Middle  26789  27123        1.2 #> 3 High School 33322  35678        7.1

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
what: 9. North Dakota has 47 districts with under 100 students
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Tiny rural schools define landscape. 47 districts fewer 100 students. ’s 28% districts.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size_category = case_when(     n_students < 100 ~ "Under 100",     n_students < 500 ~ "100-499",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-999",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1,000-4,999",     TRUE ~ "5,000+"   )) %>%   count(size_category) #>   size_category  n #> 1     Under 100 47 #> 2       100-499 78 #> 3       500-999 23 #> 4   1,000-4,999 14 #> 5        5,000+  6

previous_headings: What can you find with ndschooldata?
title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Native American students 8% enrollment concentrated high-poverty districts. Tribal schools serve 3,000 students. face unique challenges deserve attention.
code: # Native American enrollment # Note: Main NDDPI file doesn't include demographics enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   filter(grepl("Standing Rock|Fort Totten|Turtle Mountain|Fort Yates", district_name)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) #>            district_name n_students #> 1 Turtle Mountain Schools       2345 #> 2    Standing Rock School        456 #> 3       Fort Totten School        289 #> 4      Fort Yates School         234

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: See full vignette insights.

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("almartin82/ndschooldata")

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
code: library(ndschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Check available years get_available_years()

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
code: import pyndschooldata as nd  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = nd.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent = nd.fetch_enr_multi([2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_totals = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown district_totals = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)  # Check available years years = nd.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: Levels: State, district (~168) Grade levels: K-12 plus totals Demographics: Limited (main file; available via insights.nd.gov)

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: School-level data (district aggregates) Race/ethnicity demographics (available separately via insights.nd.gov) Special populations (LEP, Special Ed, FRPL) Pre-K enrollment

title: ndschooldata - North Dakota School Enrollment Data
text: North Dakota uses “CC-DDD” format: - CC: 2-digit county code (01-53) - DDD: 3-digit district number Examples: - 09-001: Fargo Public Schools (Cass County) - 08-001: Bismarck Public Schools (Burleigh County) - 53-007: Williston Basin School District (Williams County)

what: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
title: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data North Dakota Department Public Instruction.

title: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year end. Year end academic year - e.g., 2024 2023-24 school year. Valid values 2008-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download NDDPI.

title: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, district_name, enrollment counts grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch North Dakota enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district fargo <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(district_id == "09-001") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: ndschooldata package provides functions downloading processing school enrollment data North Dakota Department Public Instruction (NDDPI).

title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: Data downloaded NDDPI website: https://www.nd.gov/dpi/data primary data file "EnrollmentHistoryPublicSchoolDistrict.xlsx" contains district-level enrollment grade 2008 present.

title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr: Fetch enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi: Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr: Convert wide data tidy (long) format get_available_years: List available data years

title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: Years: 2008 2025 (18 years data) Aggregation levels: State District (campus/school level) Demographics: available main file (see insights.nd.gov) Grades: K-12 (Pre-K main file)

title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: North Dakota uses "CC-DDD" format district IDs: CC: 2-digit county code (01-53) DDD: 3-digit district number within county Example: "09-001" Fargo Public Schools (Cass County, District 1)

title: ndschooldata: North Dakota School Enrollment Data — ndschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
